509  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR size_t
510  to_hex_bytes(unsigned wrap_width = 0) const noexcept {

513  }

530  char *to_base58(char *dest, size_t dest_size, unsigned wrap_width = 0) const;
531 
534  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR size_t
535  to_base58_bytes(unsigned wrap_width = 0) const noexcept {
536  const size_t bytes = length() / 8 * 11 + (length() % 8 * 43 + 31) / 32;
537  return wrap_width ? bytes + bytes / wrap_width : bytes;
538  }
539 
543  byte *from_base58(byte *dest, size_t dest_size,
544  bool ignore_spaces = false) const;
545 
548  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR size_t from_base58_bytes() const noexcept {
549  return length() / 11 * 8 + length() % 11 * 32 / 43;
550  }
551 
555  char *to_base64(char *dest, size_t dest_size, unsigned wrap_width = 0) const;
556 
559  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR size_t
560  to_base64_bytes(unsigned wrap_width = 0) const noexcept {
561  const size_t bytes = (length() + 2) / 3 * 4;
562  return wrap_width ? bytes + bytes / wrap_width : bytes;
563  }
564 
568  byte *from_base64(byte *dest, size_t dest_size,
569  bool ignore_spaces = false) const;
570 
573  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR size_t from_base64_bytes() const noexcept {
574  return (length() + 3) / 4 * 3;
575  }

667  void swap(::std::basic_string_view<C, T> &view) noexcept {
668  static_assert(sizeof(C) == 1, "Must be single byte characters");
669  const auto temp = ::std::basic_string_view<C, T>(*this);
670  *this = view;
671  view = temp;
672  }
673 #endif /* __cpp_lib_string_view >= 201606L */

784  compare_lexicographically(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept;

786  friend inline bool operator<(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept;
787  friend inline bool operator>(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept;

789  friend inline bool operator>=(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept;
790  friend inline bool operator!=(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept;

793  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR bool is_valid() const noexcept {
794  return !(iov_base == nullptr && iov_len != 0);
795  }
796 
799  inline static slice invalid() noexcept { return slice(size_t(-1)); }
800

802  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR slice(size_t invalid_length) noexcept
803  : ::MDBX_val({nullptr, invalid_length}) {}
804 };
805 
806 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
807 
809 template <class ALLOCATOR = legacy_allocator> class buffer {
810  friend class txn;
811  /* FIXME: replace std::string with custom silo.
812  * The std::string<char> does not guarantee any alignment for allocated
813  * buffer. For instance short values may be stored within internal inplace
814  * buffer, which might odd address. Moreover, allocator for the `char` type
815  * may return unaligned/odd address. This may UB for placing a 32-bit and
816  * 64-bit values.
817  * So seems the std::string<> should be replaced with ad hoc solution. */
818  using silo = ::mdbx::string<ALLOCATOR>;
819  silo silo_;
820  ::mdbx::slice slice_;
821 
822  void insulate() {
823  assert(is_reference());
824  silo_.assign(slice_.char_ptr(), slice_.length());
825  slice_.iov_base = const_cast<char *>(silo_.data());
826  }
827 
828  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR const byte *
829  silo_begin() const noexcept {
830  return static_cast<const byte *>(static_cast<const void *>(silo_.data()));
831  }
832 
833  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR const byte *
834  silo_end() const noexcept {
835  return silo_begin() + silo_.capacity();
836  }
837 
838  struct data_preserver : public exception_thunk {
839  buffer data;
840  data_preserver(ALLOCATOR &allocator) : data(allocator) {}
841  static int callback(void *context, MDBX_val *target, const void *src,
842  size_t bytes) noexcept;
843  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR operator MDBX_preserve_func() const noexcept {
844  return callback;
845  }
846  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR operator const buffer &() const noexcept {
847  return data;
848  }
849  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR operator buffer &() noexcept { return data; }
850  };
851 
852 public:
856 
857  using allocator_type = ALLOCATOR;
858  enum : size_t {
859  max_length = MDBX_MAXDATASIZE,
860  default_shrink_threshold = 1024
861  };
862 
864  MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR allocator_type get_allocator() const {
865  return silo_.get_allocator();
866  }
867 
870  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR bool
871  is_freestanding() const noexcept {
872  return size_t(byte_ptr() - silo_begin()) < silo_.capacity();
873  }
874 
877  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR bool
878  is_reference() const noexcept {
879  return !is_freestanding();
880  }
881 
884  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR size_t
885  capacity() const noexcept {
886  return is_freestanding() ? silo_.capacity() : 0;
887  }
888 
891  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR size_t
892  headroom() const noexcept {
893  return is_freestanding() ? slice_.byte_ptr() - silo_begin() : 0;
894  }
895 
898  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR size_t
899  tailroom() const noexcept {
900  return is_freestanding() ? capacity() - headroom() - slice_.length() : 0;
901  }
902 
904  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR const byte *byte_ptr() const noexcept {
905  return slice_.byte_ptr();
906  }
907 
911  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR byte *byte_ptr() noexcept {
912  assert(is_freestanding());
913  return const_cast<byte *>(slice_.byte_ptr());
914  }
915 
917  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR const char *char_ptr() const noexcept {
918  return slice_.char_ptr();
919  }
920 
924  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR char *char_ptr() noexcept {
925  assert(is_freestanding());
926  return const_cast<char *>(slice_.char_ptr());
927  }
928 
930  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR const void *data() const noexcept {
931  return slice_.data();
932  }
933 
937  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR void *data() noexcept {
938  assert(is_freestanding());
939  return const_cast<void *>(slice_.data());
940  }
941 
943  MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX20_CONSTEXPR size_t
944  length() const noexcept {
945  return MDBX_CONSTEXPR_ASSERT(is_reference() ||
946  slice_.length() + headroom() ==
947  silo_.length()),
948  slice_.length();
949  }
950 
951  void make_freestanding() {
952  if (is_reference())
953  insulate();
954  }

958  : silo_(allocator), slice_(src) {
959  if (!make_reference)
960  insulate();
961  }

1500 struct value_result {
1501  slice value;
1502  bool done;
1503  value_result(const slice &value, bool done) noexcept
1504  : value(value), done(done) {}
1505  value_result(const value_result &) noexcept = default;
1506  value_result &operator=(const value_result &) noexcept = default;
1507  MDBX_CXX14_CONSTEXPR operator bool() const noexcept {
1508  assert(!done || bool(value));
1509  return done;
1510  }
1511 };

1515 struct pair {
1516  slice key, value;
1517  pair(const slice &key, const slice &value) noexcept
1518  : key(key), value(value) {}
1519  pair(const pair &) noexcept = default;
1520  pair &operator=(const pair &) noexcept = default;
1521  MDBX_CXX14_CONSTEXPR operator bool() const noexcept {
1522  assert(bool(key) == bool(value));
1523  return key;
1524  }
1525 };

1529 struct pair_result : public pair {
1530  bool done;
1531  pair_result(const slice &key, const slice &value, bool done) noexcept
1532  : pair(key, value), done(done) {}
1533  pair_result(const pair_result &) noexcept = default;
1534  pair_result &operator=(const pair_result &) noexcept = default;
1535  MDBX_CXX14_CONSTEXPR operator bool() const noexcept {
1536  assert(!done || (bool(key) && bool(value)));
1537  return done;
1538  }

2748  const buffer<ALLOCATOR> &it) {
2749  return (it.is_freestanding()
2750  ? out << "buf-" << it.headroom() << "." << it.tailroom()
2751  : out << "ref-")
2752  << it.slice();
2753 }

2791 static MDBX_CXX17_CONSTEXPR size_t strlen(const char *c_str) noexcept {
2792 #if defined(__cpp_lib_is_constant_evaluated) && \
2793  __cpp_lib_is_constant_evaluated >= 201811L
2794  if (::std::is_constant_evaluated()) {
2795  for (size_t i = 0; c_str; ++i)
2796  if (!c_str[i])
2797  return i;
2798  return 0;
2799  }
2800 #endif /* __cpp_lib_is_constant_evaluated >= 201811 */
2801 #if defined(__cpp_lib_string_view) && __cpp_lib_string_view >= 201606L
2802  return c_str ? ::std::string_view(c_str).length() : 0;
2803 #else
2804  return c_str ? ::std::strlen(c_str) : 0;
2805 #endif
2806 }
2807 
2808 MDBX_CXX14_CONSTEXPR size_t check_length(size_t bytes) {
2809  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(bytes > size_t(MDBX_MAXDATASIZE)))
2810  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY throw_max_length_exceeded();
2811  return bytes;
2812 }

2814 inline bool exception_thunk::is_clean() const noexcept { return !captured_; }
2815 
2816 inline void exception_thunk::capture() noexcept {
2817  assert(is_clean());
2818  captured_ = ::std::current_exception();
2819 }
2820 
2821 inline void exception_thunk::rethrow_captured() const {
2822  if (captured_)
2823  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY ::std::rethrow_exception(captured_);
2824 }

2844 MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR bool error::is_success() const noexcept {
2845  return code_ == MDBX_SUCCESS;
2846 }
2847 
2848 MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR bool error::is_result_true() const noexcept {
2849  return code_ == MDBX_RESULT_FALSE;
2850 }
2851 
2852 MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR bool error::is_result_false() const noexcept {
2853  return code_ == MDBX_RESULT_TRUE;
2854 }
2855 
2856 MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR bool error::is_failure() const noexcept {
2857  return code_ != MDBX_SUCCESS && code_ != MDBX_RESULT_TRUE;
2858 }

2860 MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR MDBX_error_t error::code() const noexcept { return code_; }
2861 
2862 MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR bool error::is_mdbx_error() const noexcept {
2863  return (code() >= MDBX_FIRST_LMDB_ERRCODE &&
2864  code() <= MDBX_LAST_LMDB_ERRCODE) ||
2865  (code() >= MDBX_FIRST_ADDED_ERRCODE &&
2866  code() <= MDBX_LAST_ADDED_ERRCODE);
2867 }

2869 inline void error::throw_exception(int error_code) {
2870  const error trouble(static_cast<MDBX_error_t>(error_code));
2871  trouble.throw_exception();
2872 }

2874 inline void error::throw_on_failure() const {
2875  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(is_failure()))
2876  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY throw_exception();
2877 }
2878 
2879 inline void error::success_or_throw() const {
2880  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(!is_success()))
2881  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY throw_exception();
2882 }
2883 
2884 inline void error::success_or_throw(const exception_thunk &thunk) const {
2885  assert(thunk.is_clean() || code() != MDBX_SUCCESS);
2886  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(!is_success())) {
2887  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY if (!thunk.is_clean()) thunk.rethrow_captured();
2888  else throw_exception();
2889  }
2890 }
2891 
2892 inline void error::panic_on_failure(const char *context_where,
2893  const char *func_who) const noexcept {
2894  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(is_failure()))
2895  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY panic(context_where, func_who);
2896 }

2899  const char *func_who) const noexcept {
2900  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(!is_success()))
2901  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY panic(context_where, func_who);
2902 }

2906  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY error(error_code).throw_exception();
2907 }

2917 }

2919 inline bool error::boolean_or_throw(int error_code) {
2920  switch (error_code) {
2921  case MDBX_RESULT_FALSE:
2922  return false;
2923  case MDBX_RESULT_TRUE:
2924  return true;
2925  default:
2926  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY throw_exception(error_code);
2927  }
2928 }

2933  rc.success_or_throw(thunk);
2934 }

3089 MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION MDBX_CXX14_CONSTEXPR size_t
3090 slice::hash_value() const noexcept {
3091  size_t h = length() * 3977471;
3092  for (size_t i = 0; i < length(); ++i)
3093  h = (h ^ static_cast<const uint8_t *>(data())[i]) * 1664525 + 1013904223;
3094  return h ^ 3863194411 * (h >> 11);
3095 }

3143 inline intptr_t slice::compare_fast(const slice &a, const slice &b) noexcept {
3144  const intptr_t diff = a.length() - b.length();
3145  return diff ? diff
3146  : (a.data() == b.data())
3147  ? 0
3148  : ::std::memcmp(a.data(), b.data(), a.length());
3149 }
3150 
3151 inline intptr_t slice::compare_lexicographically(const slice &a,
3152  const slice &b) noexcept {
3153  const intptr_t diff =
3154  ::std::memcmp(a.data(), b.data(), ::std::min(a.length(), b.length()));
3155  return diff ? diff : intptr_t(a.length() - b.length());
3156 }
3157 
3158 MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION inline bool operator==(const slice &a,
3159  const slice &b) noexcept {
3160  return slice::compare_fast(a, b) == 0;
3161 }
3162 
3163 MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION inline bool operator<(const slice &a,
3164  const slice &b) noexcept {
3165  return slice::compare_lexicographically(a, b) < 0;
3166 }
3167 
3168 MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION inline bool operator>(const slice &a,
3169  const slice &b) noexcept {
3170  return slice::compare_lexicographically(a, b) > 0;

3176 }
3177 
3178 MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION inline bool operator>=(const slice &a,

3181 }

3183 MDBX_NOTHROW_PURE_FUNCTION inline bool operator!=(const slice &a,

3541 inline bool env::sync_to_disk(bool force, bool nonblock) {
3542  const int err = ::mdbx_env_sync_ex(handle_, force, nonblock);
3543  switch (err) {
3544  case MDBX_SUCCESS /* flush done */:
3545  case MDBX_RESULT_TRUE /* no data pending for flush to disk */:
3546  return true;
3547  case MDBX_BUSY /* the environment is used by other thread */:
3548  return false;
3549  default:
3550  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY error::throw_exception(err);
3551  }
3552 }

3558 MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR
3559 env::reader_info::reader_info(int slot, mdbx_pid_t pid, mdbx_tid_t thread,
3560  uint64_t txnid, uint64_t lag, size_t used,
3561  size_t retained) noexcept
3562  : slot(slot), pid(pid), thread(thread), transaction_id(txnid),
3563  transaction_lag(lag), bytes_used(used), bytes_retained(retained) {}
3564 
3565 template <typename VISITOR>
3566 inline int env::enumerate_readers(VISITOR &visitor) {
3567  struct reader_visitor_thunk : public exception_thunk {
3568  VISITOR &visitor_;
3569  static int cb(void *ctx, int number, int slot, mdbx_pid_t pid,
3570  mdbx_tid_t thread, uint64_t txnid, uint64_t lag, size_t used,
3571  size_t retained) noexcept {
3572  reader_visitor_thunk *thunk = static_cast<reader_visitor_thunk *>(ctx);
3573  assert(thunk->is_clean());
3574  try {
3575  const reader_info info(slot, pid, thread, txnid, lag, used, retained);
3576  return loop_control(thunk->visitor_(info, number));
3577  } catch (... /* capture any exception to rethrow it over C code */) {
3578  thunk->capture();
3579  return loop_control::exit_loop;
3580  }
3581  }
3582  MDBX_CXX11_CONSTEXPR reader_visitor_thunk(VISITOR &visitor) noexcept
3583  : visitor_(visitor) {}
3584  };
3585  reader_visitor_thunk thunk(visitor);
3586  const auto rc = ::mdbx_reader_list(*this, thunk.cb, &thunk);
3587  thunk.rethrow_captured();
3588  return rc;
3589 }
3590 
3591 inline unsigned env::check_readers() {
3592  int dead_count;
3593  error::throw_on_failure(::mdbx_reader_check(*this, &dead_count));
3594  assert(dead_count >= 0);
3595  return static_cast<unsigned>(dead_count);
3596 }

3878 inline pair_result
3879 txn::get_equal_or_great(map_handle map, const slice &key,
3880  const slice &value_at_absence) const {
3881  pair result{key, slice()};
3882  const int err =
3883  ::mdbx_get_equal_or_great(handle_, map.dbi, &result.key, &result.value);
3884  switch (err) {
3885  case MDBX_SUCCESS:
3886  return pair_result{result.key, result.value, true};
3887  case MDBX_RESULT_TRUE:
3888  return pair_result{result.key, result.value, false};
3889  case MDBX_NOTFOUND:
3890  return pair_result{key, value_at_absence, false};
3891  default:
3892  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY error::throw_exception(err);
3893  }
3894 }

4081 inline size_t txn::put_multiple(map_handle map, const slice &key,
4082  const size_t value_length,
4083  const void *values_array, size_t values_count,
4084  put_mode mode, bool allow_partial) {
4085  MDBX_val args[2] = {{const_cast<void *>(values_array), value_length},
4086  {nullptr, values_count}};
4087  const int err = ::mdbx_put(handle_, map.dbi, const_cast<slice *>(&key), args,
4088  MDBX_put_flags_t(mode) | MDBX_MULTIPLE);
4089  switch (err) {
4090  case MDBX_SUCCESS:
4091  MDBX_CXX20_LIKELY break;
4092  case MDBX_KEYEXIST:
4093  if (allow_partial)
4094  break;
4095  mdbx_txn_break(handle_);
4096  default:
4097  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY error::throw_exception(err);
4098  }
4099  return args[1].iov_len /* done item count */;
4100 }

4199  MDBX_val *value, bool throw_notfound) const {

4201  ::mdbx_cursor_get(handle_, key, value, MDBX_cursor_op(operation));
4202  switch (err) {
4203  case MDBX_SUCCESS:

4208  MDBX_CXX17_FALLTHROUGH /* fallthrough */;
4209  default:
4210  MDBX_CXX20_UNLIKELY error::throw_exception(err);
4211  }
4212 }

4494 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4495 inline buffer<ALLOCATOR>::buffer(const txn &txn, const ::mdbx::slice &src,
4496  const ALLOCATOR &allocator)
4497  : buffer(src, !txn.is_dirty(src.data()), allocator) {}
4498 
4499 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4500 inline buffer<ALLOCATOR>::buffer(size_t head_room, size_t tail_room,
4501  const ALLOCATOR &allocator)
4502  : silo_(allocator) {
4503  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(head_room > max_length || tail_room > max_length ||
4504  head_room + tail_room > max_length))
4505  throw_max_length_exceeded();
4506  silo_.reserve(head_room + tail_room);
4507  silo_.append(head_room, '\0');
4508  slice_.iov_base = const_cast<char *>(silo_.data());
4509  assert(slice_.iov_len == 0);
4510 }
4511 
4512 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4513 inline buffer<ALLOCATOR>::buffer(size_t capacity, const ALLOCATOR &allocator)
4514  : silo_(allocator) {
4515  silo_.reserve(check_length(capacity));
4516  slice_.iov_base = const_cast<char *>(silo_.data());
4517  assert(slice_.iov_len == 0);
4518 }
4519 
4520 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4521 inline buffer<ALLOCATOR>::buffer(size_t head_room, const ::mdbx::slice &src,
4522  size_t tail_room, const ALLOCATOR &allocator)
4523  : silo_(allocator) {
4524  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(head_room > max_length || tail_room > max_length ||
4525  head_room + tail_room > max_length - slice_.length()))
4526  throw_max_length_exceeded();
4527  silo_.reserve(head_room + src.length() + tail_room);
4528  silo_.append(head_room, '\0');
4529  silo_.append(src.char_ptr(), src.length());
4530  slice_.iov_base = const_cast<char *>(silo_.data());
4531  slice_.iov_len = src.length();
4532 }
4533 
4534 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4535 inline void buffer<ALLOCATOR>::reserve(size_t wanna_headroom,
4536  size_t wanna_tailroom,
4537  size_t shrink_threshold) {
4538  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(
4539  wanna_headroom > max_length || wanna_tailroom > max_length ||
4540  wanna_headroom + wanna_tailroom > max_length - slice_.length()))
4541  throw_max_length_exceeded();
4542 
4543  wanna_headroom = std::min(std::max(headroom(), wanna_headroom),
4544  wanna_headroom + shrink_threshold);
4545  wanna_tailroom = std::min(std::max(tailroom(), wanna_tailroom),
4546  wanna_tailroom + shrink_threshold);
4547  const auto wanna_capacity = wanna_headroom + slice_.length() + wanna_tailroom;
4548  if (is_reference() || slice_.empty()) {
4549  silo_.reserve(wanna_capacity);
4550  silo_.resize(wanna_headroom);
4551  silo_.append(slice_.char_ptr(), slice_.length());
4552  } else {
4553  const auto was_headroom = headroom();
4554  if (was_headroom > wanna_headroom)
4555  silo_.erase(wanna_headroom, was_headroom - wanna_headroom);
4556  silo_.reserve(wanna_capacity);
4557  if (was_headroom < wanna_headroom)
4558  silo_.insert(was_headroom, wanna_headroom - was_headroom, '\0');
4559  }
4560  slice_.iov_base = const_cast<byte *>(silo_begin()) + wanna_headroom;
4561  assert(headroom() >= wanna_headroom &&
4562  headroom() <= wanna_headroom + shrink_threshold);
4563  assert(tailroom() >= wanna_tailroom &&
4564  tailroom() <= wanna_tailroom + shrink_threshold);
4565 }
4566 
4567 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4568 inline buffer<ALLOCATOR> &buffer<ALLOCATOR>::append(const void *src,
4569  size_t bytes) {
4570  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(tailroom() < check_length(bytes)))
4571  reserve(0, bytes);
4572  std::memcpy(static_cast<char *>(slice_.iov_base) + size(), src, bytes);
4573  slice_.iov_len += bytes;
4574  return *this;
4575 }
4576 
4577 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4578 inline buffer<ALLOCATOR> &buffer<ALLOCATOR>::add_header(const void *src,
4579  size_t bytes) {
4580  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(headroom() < check_length(bytes)))
4581  reserve(bytes, 0);
4582  slice_.iov_base =
4583  std::memcpy(static_cast<char *>(slice_.iov_base) - bytes, src, bytes);
4584  slice_.iov_len += bytes;
4585  return *this;
4586 }
4587 
4588 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4589 inline void buffer<ALLOCATOR>::swap(buffer &other)
4590 #if defined(__cpp_noexcept_function_type) && \
4591  __cpp_noexcept_function_type >= 201510L
4592  noexcept(
4593  std::allocator_traits<ALLOCATOR>::propagate_on_container_swap::value
4594 #if defined(__cpp_lib_allocator_traits_is_always_equal) && \
4595  __cpp_lib_allocator_traits_is_always_equal >= 201411L
4596  || std::allocator_traits<ALLOCATOR>::is_always_equal::value
4597 #endif /* __cpp_lib_allocator_traits_is_always_equal */
4598  )
4599 #endif /* __cpp_noexcept_function_type */
4600 {
4601  if /* checking the equality of allocators to avoid UB */
4602 #if defined(__cpp_if_constexpr) && __cpp_if_constexpr >= 201606L
4603  constexpr
4604 #endif
4605  (!std::allocator_traits<ALLOCATOR>::propagate_on_container_swap::value
4606 #if defined(__cpp_lib_allocator_traits_is_always_equal) && \
4607  __cpp_lib_allocator_traits_is_always_equal >= 201411L
4608  && !std::allocator_traits<ALLOCATOR>::is_always_equal::value
4609 #endif /* __cpp_lib_allocator_traits_is_always_equal */
4610  ) {
4611  if (MDBX_UNLIKELY(silo_.get_allocator() != other.silo_.get_allocator()))
4612  throw std::bad_alloc();
4613  }
4614  silo_.swap(other.silo_);
4615  slice_.swap(other.slice_);
4616 }
4617 
4618 template <class ALLOCATOR>
4619 inline int buffer<ALLOCATOR>::data_preserver::callback(void *context,
4620  MDBX_val *target,
4621  const void *src,
4622  size_t bytes) noexcept {
4623  auto self = static_cast<data_preserver *>(context);
4624  assert(self->is_clean());
4625  assert(&self->data.slice_ == target);
4626  (void)target;
4627  try {
4628  self->data.assign(src, bytes, false);
4629  return MDBX_RESULT_FALSE;
4630  } catch (... /* capture any exception to rethrow it over C code */) {
4631  self->capture();
4632  return MDBX_RESULT_TRUE;
4633  }
4634 }
